column12: GASTRIC BANDING SYSTEM ADJUSTMENT BASED ON A SATIETY AGENT CONCENTRATION LEVEL
column13: Methods and devices are provided for adjusting a gastric band to obtain a predetermined optimal expression of hormones. These hormones may be used to control appetite, metabolism and other weight control mechanisms. Ultimately, weight-loss efficacy is desired by tightening or loosening the gastric band based on hormone response.
column15: RAVEN JOSEPH;;VAN EPPS DENNIS

column12: Improved Device for Cleaning Windows, Scrubbing Floors, Brushing and Dusting Walls and the like.
column13: 17,978. Patmore, J. H., and Epps, E. Aug. 10. Handles.-A cleaning - appliance has an adjustable handle comprising a shaft A and an arm B which can be bent at an angle to facilitate cleaning of corners &c. This arm B carries the cleaning brushes or pads. The device for adjusting the angle of the arm and handle consists of two metal lugs D, E attached to the arms by sockets d, e. The lugs have interlocking crown teeth d<1>, e<1>, and the arms can be placed so as to be at any angle and then locked by means of the thumb-screw F. To secure the brushes and pads to the handle, a hinge is used made in two parts, the part G being fixed to the rod B or handle A, while to each brush C is secured the second part of the hinge H. The two are held together by means of the removable pin K.
column15: PATMORE JOSEPH HENRY;;EPPS ELIZABETH

column12: SINGLE POINT ACTUATION LOW-PROFILE LOCK RING FOR A MECHANICAL SEAL
column13: A mechanical seal (10) that employs a lock ring assembly (20, 22) having associated therewith a locking mechanism. The locking mechanism can include a nut element (26), such as a barrel nut, that allows an associated bolt element (24) to adjust a tightening load and position while clamping occurs of the components of the mechanical seal. This adjustment flexibility removes or reduces unwanted bending stresses in the bolt element, thus allowing for more torque to translate directly to the lock ring. The barrel nut allows for more material to remain in the lock ring, thus providing for additional overall strength relative to a traditional locking element. The lock ring also includes a plurality of flex regions in the form of notches (80) that allow the lock ring to flex when the main body (32, 50) is tightened about the shaft (12).
column15: USENIA JOSEPH;;VAN EPPS ALAN;;POWERS ROBERT

column12: Anillo de bloqueo de bajo perfil de accionamiento de punto individual para un sello mecánico
column13: Se describe un sello mecánico que emplea un ensamble de anillo de bloqueo que tiene asociado con el mismo un mecanismo de bloqueo. El mecanismo de bloqueo puede incluir un elemento de tuerca, tal como una tuerca de barril, que permite que un elemento de perno asociado ajuste una carga y posición de apriete mientras que se presenta la sujeción de los componentes del sello mecánico. Esta flexibilidad de ajuste elimina o reduce las tensiones de flexión indeseadas en el elemento de perno, permitiendo de esta manera que un par más torsional se traslade directamente al anillo de bloqueo. La tuerca de barril permite que permanezca más material en el anillo de bloqueo, proporcionado de esta manera una resistencia adicional general a un elemento de bloqueo tradicional. El anillo de bloqueo también incluye una pluralidad de regiones de flexión en la forma de muescas que permiten que el anillo de bloqueo flexione cuando el cuerpo principal se apriete alrededor del árbol.
column15: ROBERT JAMES POWERS;;JOSEPH USENIA;;ALAN VAN EPPS

column12: SINGLE POINT ACTUATION LOW-PROFILE LOCK RING FOR A MECHANICAL SEAL

column12: Single point actuation low-profile lock ring for a mechanical seal
column13: A mechanical seal (10) that employs a lock ring assembly (20, 22) having associated therewith a locking mechanism. The locking mechanism can include a nut element (26), such as a barrel nut, that allows an associated bolt element (24) to adjust a tightening load and position while clamping occurs of the components of the mechanical seal. This adjustment flexibility removes or reduces unwanted bending stresses in the bolt element, thus allowing for more torque to translate directly to the lock ring. The barrel nut allows for more material to remain in the lock ring, thus providing for additional overall strength relative to a traditional locking element. The lock ring also includes a plurality of flex regions in the form of notches (80) that allow the lock ring to flex when the main body (32, 50) is tightened about the shaft (12).

column12: ANEL DE TRAVAMENTO DE BAIXO PERFIL DE ATUAÇÃO DE PONTO ÚNICO PARA UM SELO MECÂNICO
column13: ANEL DE TRAVAMENTO DE BAIXO PERFIL DE ATUAÇÃO DE PONTO ÚNICO PARA UM SELO MECÂNICO. A presente invenção refere se a um selo mecânico (10) que emprega um conjunto de anel de travamento (20, 22) tendo associado a ele um mecanismo de travamento. O mecanismo de travamento pode incluir um elemento porca (26) como uma porca cilíndrica, que permite um elemento parafuso (24) associado para ajustar uma carga e posição de aperto enquanto ocorre a fixação dos componentes do selo mecânico. Essa flexibilidade de ajuste remove ou reduz tensões de flexão indesejadas no elemento parafuso, permitindo assim que mais torque seja transferido diretamente para o anel de travamento. A porca cilíndrica permite que mais material permaneça no anel de travamento, proporcionando assim uma resistência global adicional em relação a um elemento de travamento tradicional. O anel de travamento também inclui uma pluralidade de regiões flexíveis na forma de entalhes (80) que permitem que o anel de travamento flexione quando o corpo principal (32, 50) é apertado em torno do eixo (12).
column15: JOSEPH USENIA;;ALAN VAN EPPS;;ROBERT JAMES POWERS

column12: Dual outlet injection system
column13: A dual outlet injector is disclosed for use in a dual lance or dual port desulfurization station, whereby reagent from a given injector vessel may be injected into two separate supply pipes respectively corresponding to the dual lances or dual ports. The dual outlet injector enables a desulfurization station to be configured comprising only one supply vessel for powdered magnesium reagent and only one supply vessel for a carrier reagent such as powdered lime.
column14: WAITLEVERTCH JOSEPH R;;EPPS LARRY J;;ROSS MICHAEL S;;ESM GROUP INC
column15: WAITLEVERTCH JOSEPH R;;EPPS LARRY J;;ROSS MICHAEL S

column15: WAITLEVERTCH JOSEPH R;;EPPS LARRY J;;ROMEO NICHOLAS S

column12: ROTATIONAL LANCE DRIVE AND ROTATIONAL LANCE INJECTION METHOD
column13: Rotary lance drives for rotating a lance for injecting gas and powdered reagents into molten metal include a reciprocating rotary lance drive and an associated method. A lance mount which facilitates loading of a lance into a lance drive is also disclosed. Various lance designs are described for improving dispersion of reagent and decreasing process time, including lances having non-circular refractory portions and lances having cross-port arrangements for more evenly distributed reagent discharge.
column15: WAITLEVERTCH JOSEPH R;;EPPS LARRY J;;ROMEO NICHOLAS S

column12: injetor de saída dupla para uso em uma estação de dessulfurização, estação de dessulfurização, e, método para dissulfurização de ferro em fusão

column12: estação de dessulfurização e método para dessulfurização de ferro fundido
column13: estação de dessulfurização e método para dessulfurização de ferro fundido é exposto um injetor de saída dupla para uso em uma lança dupla ou estação de dessulfurização de porta dupla, pelo qual reagente a partir de um dado vaso de injetor pode ser injetado em dois tubos de fornecimento separados respectivamente correspondendo às lanças duplas ou portas duplas. o injetor de saída dupla permite que uma estação de dessulfurização seja configurada compreendendo somente um vaso de fornecimento para reagente de magnésio em pó e somente um vaso de fornecimento para um reagente de suporte, tal como cal em pó.
column15: JOSEPH R WAITLEVERTCH;;LARRY J EPPS;;MICHAEL S ROSS

column12: BIO-BASED BLOCK POLYMERS DERIVED FROM LIGNIN AND FATTY ACIDS
column13: The present invention pertains to bio-based block polymers synthesized from functionalized lignin-based molecules (A-monomer) and functionalized fatty acids or fatty alcohols (B-monomer) derived from plant or animal oils, waxes or fats. The block polymers can be synthesized via numerous polymerization techniques, such as reversible addition-fragmentation chain transfer (RAFT). Most importantly, this class of bio-based block polymers shows promise as providing sustainable yet scalable and tunable thermoplastic elastomers and pressure-sensitive adhesives, among other applications.
column14: EPPS III THOMAS H;;HOLMBERG ANGELA L;;STANZIONE JOSEPH F;;WOOL RICHARD;;UNIV DELAWARE

column12: Apparatus for desulfurization of iron utilizing two spaced apart lances
column13: A desulfurization apparatus which employs first and second separate independently movable spaced apart lances (10, 12), each lance having a single conduit (22) through which the desulfurization materials may flow from feed vessels (40, 42, 44, 46) into the molten iron in a ladle (16). First and second independently operable raising and lowering apparatus (28, 30) are provided, the first raising and lowering apparatus (28) being connected to the first lance (10), and the second raising and lowering apparatus (30) being connected to the second lance. Each of the first and second raising and lowering apparatus (28,30) is capable of moving the associated lance (10, 12) from between a raised position where the lower end of the associated lance is spaced above the surface of the molten iron in the ladle and a lowered position where the lower end of the associated lance is spaced within the ladle at a proper location for desulfurization of the molten iron. The first and second raising and lowering apparatus are spaced apart sufficiently so the reaction zones do not overlap even at maximum flow rate of desulfurization materials.
column15: ROSS MICHAEL S;;DOWNARD RONALD L;;EPPS LARRY J;;WAITLEVERTCH JOSEPH R

column12: COFFEE GLASS AND PROCESS FOR PRODUCING SAME
column13: A coffee glass is disclosed which is prepared by forming a melt containing above 3% to 12% water and about 88% to 97% total coffee derived solids, aromatizing the melt in a confined headspace, shaping the melt, and cooling the melt to entrap and protect the coffee aromas providing less than 20% loss of volatiles.
column15: RANKOWITZ MARSHALL M;;EPPS JACKIE R;;MACFEIGGAN PAMELA JANE SUMMERS;;SCARELLA ROBERT A;;DELLA FAVE NICHOLAS I;;MUSTO JOSEPH A
